Isaac Chan, Business  at NUSLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 08 Mar 2019It is just the portion of equity of the different subsidiaries that the company does not own, which represents the portions of the company that do not belong to shareholders.One particular concern for investors is that they do not know which part of the cash position is held by a 100% owned subsidiary, and a 51% owned subsidiary.0 comments0
